title: Indexes Introduction
subject: MongoDB
theory: Indexes support the efficient execution of queries. Without indexes, MongoDB must perform a collection scan (scan every document) to find matches. Indexes are special data structures that store a small portion of the data set in an easy-to-traverse form.

examples.explanation: Ensures no two documents can have the same email instantly.

common_mistakes.correction: Indexes consume RAM and slow down writes (every insert must update index). Index only query-heavy fields.

interview_questions.question: What is the default index in every collection?

real_world_use_cases.description: Looking up user by username requires an index on 'username' for speed.

summary: Indexes are the single most important performance optimization in MongoDB.
